comments:
While trying to do the example from
http://www.onjava.com/pub/a/onjava/2004/02/04/juie.html , I always get the
following error:
An internal error occurred during: "Launch".

I'm using Eclipse 3.1 and JUnit 3.8.1

Here's my .log:
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Launching".
!STACK 0
java.lang.RuntimeException: Couldn't get test harness for name
org.eclipse.jdt.junit.testprioritization.DefaultTestPrioritizer
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.junit.TestManipulatorManager.getPrioritizationBundle(TestManipulatorManager.java:163)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.launcher.JUnitLaunchConfiguration.createClassPath(JUnitLaunchConfiguration.java:214)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.launcher.JUnitLaunchConfiguration.createVMRunner(JUnitLaunchConfiguration.java:75)

	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.launcher.JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.launch(JUnitBaseLaunchConfiguration.java:131)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:569)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:732)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:904)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

Sorry, I didn't make it clear: the error not only occurrs in the above mentioned
example but also everytime I try to make a test in JUnit

is this a standard eclipse installation? I couldn't find a class
'org.eclipse.jdt.junit.TestManipulatorManager'

The only thing I did was installing some Plugins(PHPeclipse, JFacedDB, Omondo)
and the mentioned JUnit in my Java-lib-directory. 

And strangely, neither can I find the
'org.eclipse.jdt.junit.TestManipulatorManager' class. Maybe however, I looked in
the wrong place (Eclipse-Plugin-Dir, org.eclipse.jdt.* subdirs)?

you must also have installed the continuous testing plug-ins, these plug-ins
replace jdt.junit. Recommend to report the bug report there.

That's it. Although I can't remember it, I must have installed these plug-ins.
After deleting them, it finally works.
